questions.question_text:
Universal Containers is considering a Knowledge-Centered Support (KCS) implementation.
Which three benefits can be expected from KCS adoption? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACE
KCS increases call deflection. It does not reduce support channels. ACE

KCS involves creating and maintaining a knowledge base of articles that address common issues and questions. When customers can find answers to their questions or solutions to their problems in the knowledge base, it reduces the need for them to contact support through calls. This leads to increased call deflection, as customers can self-serve by accessing the knowledge base.

ACE!

Selected Answer: ACE
ACE for sure

comments.content:
Thats incorrect it should be 'Increased Called deflection' as users now can get answers elsewhere ie a service webpage/knowledge base etc so they wont need to call in for support all the time
Its ACE
A is wrong ,it should be Reduced call deflection.

discussion.content: Correct answer should be ACE. KCS does not reduce support channels.

C would be correct. Partner Community Login license can be used for execute reports.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.networks_analytics_limitations.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: C
Service Cloud Portal does not have access to reports https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.users_license_types_servicecloudportal.htm&type=5

questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks (CK) provides support 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. CK contracts with an external third-party help desk to provide support outside of normal business hours.
The external service agents and external support managers use Experience Cloud to create cases. External support managers need to view and execute reports with the ability to ‘Run as specified user’.
What is the recommended Experience Cloud license to meet the requirements?

discussion.content: You guys should read the comments and correct the questions based on the comments. Rando123 provided correct feedback over 9 months ago.

Work orders , cases and incidents are the only supported milestone objects 
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.entitlements_supported_objects.htm&type=5

questions.question_text: Milestones can be added to which three Object types? (Choose three.)

Cloud Kicks (CK) has recently started using Entitlements within its support process. However, CK has found many cases with inaccurate data. As many Entitlements are similarly named, service agents are selecting Entitlements that are not associated with the Account assigned on the Case.

What is the recommended method to meet the requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Lookup filters will restrict entitlements that can be selected on a case.

questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks (CK) is a global company with multiple product lines. CK is preparing to launch a public knowledge base for customers that will have 2,500 articles. The company wants an easy way for users to find relevant articles based on their location and product.

What is the recommended method to meet the requirement?

discussion.content: The answer is D... the questions is stating location and product which can be created with Category Groups https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.category_whatis.htm&type=5
User will not be able to see data categories if Data Category Visibility is not mentioned so answer will be C
